item.description: Publications While working with the Open Search Foundation in the EU, I co-authored a technical research paper with professors and researchers from European institutions including Erasmus University Rotterdam, the Leibniz Supercomputing Centre, and TU Munich. It was presented at the 5th International Open Search Symposium (OSSYM) at CERN, Geneva. Conceptual Design and Implementation of a Prototype Search Application using the Open Search Index ‚Äî Read on Zenodo Writings As part of internships and coursework, I‚Äôve written several technical papers:

üìÑ Resume 2025 Senior Software Engineer @ Planned, Montr√©al, QC Oct 2024 ‚Äì Present Built multi-agent workflows in the supplier-sourcing platform using Temporal, supporting Planned‚Äôs $35M Series B. Developed a multi-city travel cost optimization tool for global corporate events (Next.js, TypeScript/tRPC, React) with multiple third-party API integrations; served as domain owner from design through delivery. Designed a prompt library (exposed via GitHub Models ‚Üí later Latitude) enabling non-technical stakeholders to A/B test LLM prompts; exposed reusable agentic API clients for engineers to implement flexibly.

“Finished products are for decadent minds.” ‚Äî Bail Channis, Second Foundation Hi! üëã I’m Rohit ‚Äî an entrepreneur, computer scientist, and product builder. I graduated in Computer Science from the University of Waterloo, spent time around the LHC at CERN (even published a small paper), and today I split my energy between shipping valuable software and understanding how systems scale behind it ‚Äî from product reasoning to quantum information.
